details.description: You can still apply for Education Maintenance Allowance (EMA) if you're studying in Northern Ireland, Scotland or Wales. Students in England may be able to get a 16 to 19 Bursary Fund
details.body:
You may be able to claim Education Maintenance Allowance (EMA) if you’re studying in Northern Ireland, Scotland or Wales. EMA is now closed in England.

You can apply for:

  • EMA in Northern Ireland
  • EMA in Scotland
  • EMA in Wales

If you’re studying in England, you may be able to get a 16-19 Bursary Fund to help with your studying costs.

To find out more about the closure of EMA in England, call the Learner Support helpline on: 0800 121 8989.

tags.title: Apprenticeships,14 to 19 education and training at work

details.description: Includes finding a course, finding an apprenticeship, 16-19 Bursary Fund
Get help if you're at school, planning to go on to further or higher education, looking for training or interested in a student or career development loan.
If you're 16 to 19 you might be able to get £1,200 from the 16 to 19 Bursary Fund from your school, college or training provider
